snippet: CBS and Time Warner have been at odds over what are known as retransmission fees, which cable companies have increasingly been compelled to pay to broadcasters.
abstract: War between CBS and Time Warner Cable intensifies when cable company withdraws CBS stations of its three million customers in markets including New York, Los Angeles and Dallas; companies have been at odds over what are known as retransmission fees, which cable companies have increasingly been compelled to pay broadcasters.
lead_paragraph: CBS and Time Warner have been at odds over what are known as retransmission fees, which cable companies have increasingly been compelled to pay to broadcasters.

headline.main: After a Fee Dispute With Time Warner Cable, CBS Goes Dark for Three Million Viewers
headline.print_headline: After a Fee Dispute With Time Warner Cable, CBS Goes Dark for Three Million Viewers
